Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Pre-Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: below junction of neck and shoulder, band of tongues; below, mostly reserved with single thorned double cable and stalked rosette; possible inscription on exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA35. The sherd is also published in M. Kerschner, Perspektiven der Keramikforschung in Naukratis (1999) 83 Pl. 8,4.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 118, no. 330.7, pl. XXXVI, no. 330.7)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220, no. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.043)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4817 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
